name: 宋裕祺
objective: This course provides the students an insight into structural dynamics. Some essential classical analysis methods are described. Making the students a better understanding of structural dynamics in both theoretical background and practical application is the core of the course.
schedule:
Week 1  Introduction
Week 2  Equation of Motion (I): 
Newton Theory and Virtual Displacement Method 
Week 3  Equation of Motion (II): 
Hamilton’s Theory and Lagrange Equation
Week 4  Equation of Motion (III):
Partial Differential Equation for Continuous System
Week 5  Dynamic Performance of SDOF System (I)
Free Vibration of Undamped System
Week 6  Dynamic Performance of SDOF System (II)
Free Vibration of Damped System
Week 7  Dynamic Performance of SDOF System (III)
Forced Vibration of System Subjected to Periodic Loading
Week 8  Dynamic Performance of SDOF System (IV)
Forced Vibration of System Subjected to General Loading
Week 9  Midterm
Week 10   Dynamic Performance of MDOF System (I)
Characteristic of Equation of Motion 
Week 11  Dynamic Performance of MDOF System (II)
Modal Superimposition Method
Week 12  Dynamic Performance of MDOF System (III)
Modal Superimposition Method
Week 13  Dynamic Performance of Continuous System (I)
Vibration of Bar and Beam
Week 14  Dynamic Performance of Structure Subjected to Earthquake (I)
        Response Spectrum Method & Time-history Analysis Method for SDOF system
Week 15  Dynamic Performance of Structure Subjected to Earthquake (II)
   　　Response Spectrum Method for MDOF system
Week 16  Dynamic Performance of Structure Subjected to Earthquake (III)
   　　Response Spectrum Method for MDOF system
Week 17  Numerical Analysis of Dynamic Performance
   　　Central Difference, Newmark β, Wilson-  Method
Week 18  Final
materials:
Dynamics of Structures (5th Edition), by Anil K. Chopra, Prentice-hall International Series
Hangout by Prof. Y.C. Sung
